text: Look back at the problems in this investigation. For which problems did you use least common multiples? For which problems did you use greatest common factors? How did you decide?

Least common multiples are used in Problems 2.1 and 2.2, and greatest common factors are used in Problem 2.3.

In general, you can use the least common multiple to decide when something will happen next. Least common multiples have a feel of cycles of things happening.

You can use the greatest common factor to decide how to divide up two quantities. Greatest common factors have a feel of "brealing or dividing things up."
